name: Quinoa Bowl
description: Single-bowl meal full of colorful vegetables, protein, and healthy fats. Visual feast and nutrition combined.

instructions.instruction: Rinse quinoa under cold water. Add to pot with 2 cups water and bring to boil.
Once boiling, reduce heat, cover, and simmer 15 minutes. Then rest 5 minutes covered.
Cube sweet potatoes. Spread on baking sheet, toss with 1 tbsp oil, cumin, and salt.
Spread drained chickpeas on same sheet or another. Toss with 1 tbsp oil and smoked paprika.
instructions.tip: Pat chickpeas dry with paper towel for crispiness.
Chickpeas should be slightly crispy, potatoes golden.

instructions.instruction: Make tahini sauce: Mix tahini, lemon juice, soy sauce, honey, and 2 tbsp water.
instructions.tip: If sauce is too thick, add more water until drizzle-able.
Slice at last minute - browns quickly.

instructions.instruction: Build bowls: Spread quinoa as base in wide bowls.
Arrange vegetables in sections: sweet potato, chickpeas, cabbage, carrot, edamame, avocado.
instructions.tip: Place colors next to each other for rainbow effect.

instructions.instruction: Drizzle tahini sauce on top and sprinkle sesame seeds.

instructions.tip: Mix everything together while eating - all flavors combine.

tips: Also known as Buddha bowl, poke bowl, or nourish bowl.
Prep ingredients ahead and store in fridge - meal prep friendly.
Swap vegetables based on season and preference.
Add chicken, salmon, or tofu for more protein.
Can use peanut sauce instead of tahini.
storageInfo: Store ingredients in separate containers 3-4 days. Add avocado and sauce fresh.
servingSuggestion: Serve in wide, deep bowls for Instagram-worthy presentation. Top with sesame and microgreens.
variations: Protein boost: Add grilled chicken or salmon on top.
Vegan: Use coconut aminos instead of tahini.
Mexican: Add black beans, corn, and salsa.
Asian: Add edamame, wakame, and ginger-sesame dressing.
